meta.content: Developer Tutorials show you how to complete development related tasks with step-by-step instructions.
meta.name: description

div.p: Developer Tutorials show you how to complete development related tasks with step-by-step instructions.

a.title: In this tutorial, you use an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Free Tier account to set up an Oracle Linux instance. Then, you install an Apache web server and PHP and access your new server from the internet.

li.a: Free Tier: Install Apache and PHP on an Oracle Linux Instance

a.title: In this tutorial, you use an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Free Tier account to set up a compute instance on the latest version of Ubuntu. Then, you install an Apache web server and PHP and access your new server from the internet. Finally, this tutorial covers all the steps necessary to set up a virtual network for your host and connect the host to the internet.

li.a: Free Tier: Install Apache and PHP on an Ubuntu Instance

a.title: In this tutorial, you use an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Free Tier account to set up an Ubuntu instance. Then, you set up a virtual environment for your host. Finally, you install Flask, a lightweight web application framework for Python.

li.a: Free Tier: Install Flask on an Ubuntu VM

a.title: In this tutorial, you use an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Free Tier account to set up an Ubuntu compute instance. Then, you set up a Helidon MicroProfile (MP) server for your host.

li.a: Free Tier: Set up Helidon on an Ubuntu Instance

a.title: In this tutorial, you use an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Free Tier account to set up an Oracle Linux compute instance. Then, you install a Node Express application and access your new app from the internet. Finally, this tutorial covers all the steps necessary to set up a virtual network for your host and connect the host to the internet.

li.a: Free Tier: Install Node Express on an Oracle Linux Instance

a.title: In this tutorial, use an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Free Tier account to set up an Oracle Linux compute instance. Then, install a Spring Boot application and access your new app from the internet. Finally, this tutorial covers all the steps necessary to set up a virtual network for your host and connect the host to the internet.

li.a: Free Tier: Install Spring Boot on an Oracle Linux Instance
Free Tier: Install WordPress on an Ubuntu Instance

a.title: In this tutorial, you use an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure account to set up Oracle Functions development using Cloud Shell. Then, you create a function application and a function.

li.a: Functions: Get Started using Cloud Shell

a.title: In this tutorial, you use an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure account to set up Oracle Functions development. Then, you create a function application and a function.

li.a: Functions: Get Started using the CLI

a.title: In this tutorial, you use Oracle Functions to process data passed from Oracle API Gateway. You create a Python function that uses the runtime context to extract HTTP information passed in a request.

li.a: Functions: Call a Function using API Gateway

a.title: In this tutorial, you use Oracle Functions to validate an API key passed from Oracle API Gateway. An API key is a simple method for securing an API by requiring the client to pass a specific token. The gateway can use the token as a custom authorizer to validate requests. You create a Python function that validates the token and returns an authenticated JSON response.

li.a: Functions: Validate an API Key with API Gateway
Kubernetes: Deploy a Java Helidon Application
Kubernetes: Deploy a Node Express Application
Kubernetes: Deploy a Spring Boot Application
Kubernetes Using Cloud Shell: Deploy a Python Flask Application
Kubernetes Using Cloud Shell: Deploy a Java Helidon Application
Kubernetes Using Cloud Shell: Deploy a Spring Boot Application

a.title: In this tutorial, you set up Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Terraform provider scripts, documented in the Terraform Registry, to connect to your account. To confirm the setup, you fetch information from your tenancy.

li.a: Terraform: Set Up OCI Terraform

a.title: In this tutorial, you use Terraform to connect to your Oracle Cloud Infrastructure account and create a compartment in your tenancy.

li.a: Terraform: Create a Compartment

a.title: In this tutorial, you use Terraform to create a compute instance in your Oracle Cloud Infrastructure tenancy.

li.a: Terraform: Create a Compute Instance

a.title: In this tutorial, you use Terraform to create a virtual cloud network in your Oracle Cloud Infrastructure tenancy.

li.a: Terraform: Create a Virtual Cloud Network

a.title: In this tutorial, you use Terraform to set up a simple infrastructure in your Oracle Cloud Infrastructure account.

li.a: Terraform: Set Up a Simple Infrastructure with OCI Terraform

a.title: In this tutorial, you use Terraform to set up a Kubernetes cluster in your Oracle Cloud Infrastructure account.

li.a: Terraform: Create a Kubernetes Cluster

a.title: In this tutorial, you set up the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Terraform resource discovery feature, documented in the Terraform Registry, to connect to your account. To confirm the setup, you use resource discovery to fetch information from your tenancy and create a script for it.

li.a: Terraform: Set Up Resource Discovery

a.title: In this tutorial, you create scripts and state files for resources in your account through the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Terraform provider's resource discovery feature. Then you use Terraform to manage the resources.

li.a: Terraform: Create Scripts and State Files with Resource Discovery
Getting Started with Data Catalog
Harvesting from Oracle Object Storage
Harvesting from Autonomous Databases with Private Access
Harvesting On Premise Data Sources

p.strong: Receiving Notifications for Data Catalog Events

li.a: Receiving Notifications for Data Catalog Harvest Events
Getting Started with Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Data Flow
Develop Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Data Flow Applications Locally, Deploy to The Cloud
Use Your Data Flow Delegation Token to Access Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Resources
Migrating Spark Applications to Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Data Flow
Connect to Data Integration
Import Sample Data
Connect to Data Sources
Ingest and Transform Data Using a Data Flow
Create an Integration Task to Configure and Run a Data Flow
Load Data into Autonomous Data Warehouse Using a Data Loader Task
Getting Started with Data Science
